column4: Source name in the format '2CXO Jhhmmss.s{+|-}ddmmss[X]'

Major radius of the 95% confidence level position error ellipse
Source may be confused (source regions overlap in one or more contributing stacked observations)
Source is saturated in all observations; source properties are unreliable
Highest flux significance (S/N) across all stacked observations and energy bands

Aperture-corrected net energy flux inferred from the source region aperture, best estimate derived from the longest block of a multi-band, flux-ordered Bayesian Block analysis of the contributing observations, and calculated by counting X-ray events (68% upper confidence limit); ACIS broad (0.5-7.0 keV) energy band

Aperture-corrected net energy flux inferred from the source region aperture, best estimate derived from the longest block of a multi-band, flux-ordered Bayesian Block analysis of the contributing observations, and calculated by counting X-ray events (68% lower confidence limit); HRC wide (~0.1-10.0 keV) energy band

Intra-observation Gregory-Loredo variability index in the range [0, 10]: indicates whether the source region photon flux is constant within an observation (highest value across all observations); ACIS broad (0.5-7.0 keV) energy band
Inter-observation variability index in the range [0, 10]: indicates whether the source region photon flux is constant between observations; ACIS broad (0.5-7.0 keV) energy band

Inter-observation variability index in the range [0, 10]: indicates whether the source region photon flux is constant between observations; HRC wide (~0.1-10.0 keV) energy band
Type of match between master source and stacked observation detection; u = unique match, a = ambiguous match; n = non-detection
Observation identifier
Observation interval number
Detection region identifier (component number)
Instrument used for the observation; 'ACIS' or 'HRC'
PSF 90% ECF aperture off-axis angle
PSF 90% ECF aperture azimuthal angle
Effective single observation exposure time, after applying the good time intervals and the deadtime correction factor; vignetting and dead area corrections are NOT applied

Compact detection may be confused (bit encoded: 1: background region overlaps another background region; 2: background region overlaps another source region; 4: source region overlaps another background region; 8: source region overlaps another source region; 256: compact detection is overlaid on an extended detection)
Detection is saturated; detection properties are unreliable

Significance of the single-observation detection determined from the ratio of the single-observation detection photon flux to the estimated error in the photon flux; ACIS broad (0.5-7.0 keV) energy band

Significance of the single-observation detection determined from the ratio of the single-observation detection photon flux to the estimated error in the photon flux; HRC wide (~0.1-10.0 keV) energy band
Detector elements over which the background region bounding box dithers during the observation

Detection is extended, or deconvolved compact detection extent is inconsistent with a point source at the 90% confidence level in one or more energy bands (bit encoded: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32: deconvolved compact detection extent is not consistent with a point source in the ACIS ultrasoft, soft, medium, hard, broad, or HRC wide (~0.1-10.0 keV) energy band, respectively; 256: extended detection)
